thread.title: FCC Fines Sprint $1.2 Million for 911 Outage
thread.title_full: FCC Fines Sprint $1.2 Million for 911 Outage

title: FCC Fines Sprint $1.2 Million for 911 Outage
text:
28 FCC Fines Sprint $1.2 Million for 911 Outage 
CIO Today: The whole idea behind the 911 emergency service is that it’s available whenever a phone is within reach. That wasn’t the case, however, during a significant part of 2014 for some Sprint customers -- and now the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) is making the company pay for it.
